attributes.action: Ask Honours Forfeiture Committee to debate Philip Green's (BHS) Honour
attributes.additional_details:
"John Mann, the Labour MP and member of the Treasury select committee, called on Green to repay £400m of dividends that were paid out of BHS, or give up his knighthood."

"Mann said: 'Sir Philip Green and his family have made millions out of BHS and its hardworking staff. He took over a company with a healthy pension pot, yet when he sold BHS a black hole had appeared in its fund." 
- The Guardian 26 04 16
attributes.background: In line with Petition committee power to "ask another parliamentary committee to look into the topic raised by a petition" I would ask that the Petition committee ask the Honours Forfeiture Committee to look into the possibility that Philip Green (BHS) has damaged the honours system’s reputation.

rejection.details:
We can't accept petitions asking for people's honours to be taken away. You can find out more about how honours are taken away here: https://www.gov.uk/honours

The Honours Forfeiture Committee is not a parliamentary committee. The Petitions Committee therefore does not have the power to ask that committee to take action on the topic raised by this petition.
